result.execSummary:
The defendant Devon Michael King was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
All financial obligations paid through the Clerk of Courts office are subject to civil judgment and certification to the Department of Revenue on any balance owed after 60 days from entry of judgment.
The defendant is placed on a payment plan of $20 a month starting 60 days after release.

Granted Good time 
Granted work release
Concurrent with: 21CM177 and Chisago Co case 13CR20-261, but Consecutive to any other sentence
The Def is to contact Ashland Co Jail to make arrangements to provide a DNA specimen w/in 7 days.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

09:31 AM Defendant Devon Michael King in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Ruth Diane Kressel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    COVID - ZOOM; all parties agree to appear via ZOOM today. 21CM177,22CM16-- Cases are set for a PLEAS.. PLQ in each file, def will plead NC to Ct 1 21CM177, Ct 1 22CM16 and Ct 2 will be DRI.  Agreement-- 200 days jail, CC with each other and CC with Chisago CO 13CR20261 C/S any other sentence. Ct costs and DNA. State will move to dismiss the repeater charge on Case 21CM177--  Ct finds the def know and vol waives right to be present in the court room. State complied with Vic rights. Ct rv'd the VIS in the case. PLEADS NC to the two counts. Signed plq, understands elements. Admits he is a repeater and prior conviction. Ct accepts pleas, factual basis in the compl, finds the def G on Count 1 is 21CM177 and Ct 1 in 22CM16, Ct 2 is DRI. State comments on sentencing. Atty comments on sentencing. Def makes Statements to the court. 
Ct orders-- 
 on each count-- 200 days jail, Granted good time and work release, C/C with each other and C/C with Chisago Co case 13CR20-261, C/S to any other sentence, Ct costs, DNA within 7 days. Payment plan $20/ month 60 days after release. Credit is set at 0 today.
Def is set up to appear by zoom from Faribault MN on June 10; ka
